intro: Cotylanthera yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan's cotylanthera, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces small, white to pale pink flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
